DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Spearmint Tea Relieving Osteoarthritis Knee
DOC.detailed_description: Healthy adult clinical diagnosis osteoarthritis knee recruit undergo brief phone screen interview , follow detailed in-person screening process , determine study eligibility . Eligible participant match accord sex , baseline pain accord Western Ontario McMaster Universities Arthritis Index ( WOMAC ) score , duration osteoarthritis . Participants randomly assign receive either investigative high rosmarinic acid spearmint tea comparable placebo mint tea . During 4-month treatment period , participant consume two cup ( 300 mL morning 300 mL evening ) either high rosmarinic acid spearmint tea ( approximately 300 mg rosmarinic acid per day ) commercial spearmint tea ( approximately 20 mg rosmarinic acid per day ) daily . Data collection occur baseline ( week 0 ) , mid-treatment ( week 8 ) , post-treatment ( week 16 ) , follow-up ( week 20 ) . Outcome measure include WOMAC SF-36 score , physical function ( 6-minute walk , stair climb task ) , inflammatory marker ( serum C-reactive protein ) , self-reported change pain medication use . In sub-set consenting participant deem eligible study physician , synovial fluid sample drawn knee analyse cartilage degradation biomarkers ( GAG , COMP , PGE2 , NO ) baseline ( week 0 ) post-treatment ( week 16 ) .
